divs: sighting details1.smoking cigarette on sun porch facing south. 2.observed a glowing, yellow orange, circular to oval disc or spherical light getting brighter and appearing to approach from ssw to nne direction in a head-on direction. 3.at first sight, possibly a meteorite or an aircraft\helicopter in trouble. looking like a fireball of some sort. 4.circular to oval disc\spherical shape seemingly hoverng or proceeding at a speed too slow to be mistaken for an aircraft\helicopter. no visible aircraft navigational red\green\white lights, thus eliminating aircraft in trouble. direction appeared to come up canadian side of st.clair river at approximately 5000 feet(difficult to estimate at night but above small scattered cumulus clouds to the left of glowing object that at that time of night would be at elevation 2000 to 3000 feet). after approximately 5 minutes seemed to go upward at faster speed at climb rate angle of 60 to 70 degrees and now appearing teardrop-shaped and slowly disappeared from view. 5.intrigued and curious by sighting to the point of going outside to observe unidentified object for approximately 5 to 10 minutes. feeling of excitement at having seen this object. tried to send report to ufo canada network shortly afterward with no confirmation that it was actually sent and therefore i am forwarding this report to your organization. 6.observed visually a now teardrop-shaped object disappear upward at a steep angle from canadian side of st.clair river to u.s. side into a partly clear sky. n.b: no sound heard from unidentified object. n.b: should have been easily seen by anyone crossing bluewater bridges between sarnia, ontario and port huron, michigan and any pleasure craft or commercial vessel traffic on lake st clair, st clair river, and lower lake huron cut area.
